segments.text: So , you ’ re applying for a B2 visa , where is your final destination and what ’ s the purpose of your trip to the United States ?
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: I ’ m going to visit my brother . he ’ s just had a baby . He lives in Minneapolis .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: And how long do you you plan to remain in the United States ?
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: I ’ ll be here for approximately three weeks . See , here ’ s my return ticket for the twenty-sixth of March .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: And , who is sponsoring your trip ?
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: My brother , here , this is an invitation letter from him . I will stay with him and his family in their home .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: Alright , tell me about the ties you have to your home country .
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: Well , I own a house . actually , I ’ m leaving my dog there with my neighbors . I have a car at home , and oh , my job ! I ’ m employed by Tornal as an engineer . Actually , I only have three weeks ’ vacation , so I have to go back to work at the end of March .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: And what evidence do you have that you are financially independent ?
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: Well , I do have assets in my country . like I said , I own a house , and see , here ’ s a bank statement showing my investments , and my bank balance .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: I ’ m sorry , sir , we cannot grant you a B2 visa at this time , instead , you are granted a resident visa ! Congratulations , you are the millionth person to apply for a visa ! You win ! Congratulations !
segments.speaker: S1
